# micromark-util-encode

Micromark utility to encode dangerous HTML characters.

## Usage

This package encodes dangerous HTML characters, making text safe for embedding in HTML.

This is particularly useful when creating custom micromark extensions.

**Installation:**

```bash
npm install micromark-util-encode
```

**Import in Node.js (ESM):**

```javascript
import { encode } from 'micromark-util-encode';
```

**Import in Deno (ESM):**

```javascript
import { encode } from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-encode@latest';
```

**Import in a browser (ESM with esm.sh):**

```html
<script type="module">
  import { encode } from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-encode@latest?bundle';
  const encodedString = encode('<3'); // Output: '&lt;3'
  console.log(encodedString);
</script>
```

## API

### `encode(value)`

Encodes dangerous HTML characters in the input `value`.

**Parameters:**

* `value` (string): The string to encode.

**Returns:**

(string): The encoded string.


**Example:**

```javascript
import { encode } from 'micromark-util-encode';

const encodedValue = encode('<div>Hello & World</div>');
console.log(encodedValue); // Output: '&lt;div&gt;Hello &amp; World&lt;/div&gt;'
```

## Compatibility

This package is compatible with maintained versions of Node.js and works with `micromark@^3`.
